suncertify.client

Class BrokerLocalClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.BrokerClient
      • suncertify.client.BrokerLocalClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, DBUpdateListener

    public class BrokerLocalClient
extends BrokerClient
implements DBUpdateListener
    The BrokerLocalClient is the client used when the application the application is running in "stand alone" mode. It extends the BrokerClient class and implements the DBUpdateListener interface.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    BrokerClient, DBUpdateListener

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerLocalClient

        BrokerLocalClient()
        The no argument constructor. Notice that is has package access and that is because instances of this class cannot be created directly. This is achieved through calling the baseclass which also serves as a factory.
        See Also:
        BrokerClient.getClient(AppRunMode)

    • Method Detail

      • startClient

        public void startClient()
                 throws BrokerClientException
        This method executes the startup process for the local client. The steps include the following:
        • Request client configuration parameters by displaying the client configuration dialog
        • Acquiring a reference to the BrokerServer object
        • Acquiring a reference to a LocalClientController object
        • Registering for DB updates with the DB Server
        • Starting the server - this step is needed because the client is running is stand alone mode
        • Creating the client GUI
        Overrides:
        startClient in class BrokerClient
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - if the process was unsuccessful.
        See Also:
        LocalClientController, BrokerLocalServer.startServer(), BrokerAppClientGUI

      • stopClient

        public void stopClient()
                throws BrokerClientException
        This method executes the client shutdown process if the client startup was previously done successfully. The client shutdown process includes:
        • Unregistering of the client from DB from the DB BrokerServer
        • Stopping the controller.
        • Stopping the server.
        Specified by:
        stopClient in class BrokerClient
        Throws:
        BrokerClientException - if an error was encountered during the shutdown process.
        See Also:
        BrokerServer.unregisterUpdateListener(int), ClientController.stopController(), BrokerLocalServer.stopServer()
